page.title: 08The Vicar of Trinity Church
page.content: Yesterday we went to interview the vicar of Holy Trinity Church Mr Paul Le Sueur.He told us that the church was built in 1848 and showed us plans of what they were going to change in the church;such as putting in toilets,a kitchen and a playroom. Before the church was there the land was just countryside.He told us that the church measured roughly 35metres by 20metres and there are some 25 stained glass windows.The vicar told us that the church is a daughter church of Rotherfield Greys. He holds three services a week all on a sunday and about 130 people attend these services.The church itself is made of stone,flint facing and brick;there are also three hand wrung bells.
